Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location at all. My room was very small but enough to stay. no prob. But it was only one bad piont that is the room has smell of smoke little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Never again! Insects!...”
Reviews.Author: Any123
Reviews.Content: "+" Location is near Termini station - about 5 minutes walk, so it’s close to metro and buses. Free wi-fi. Low price. "-" I’ve seen few cockroaches. There are bed bugs! (bed insects - cimici). Insects were living in a bed, I’ve seen them a lot, caught them, I’ve seen small blood spots on the bed-sheets and I’ve been bitten. The Hotel is on the fifth floor of an old multi-apartment dirty building and the elevator is antique and very small, with hand-opening/closing doors. (I was lucky, lift was not broken! In other case I could not climb to the 5th floor with my bag ) Air conditioner for extra payment - 5euro per day Staff did not speak English. I was asked to pay for the room for a week upon arrival (at first day) I was asked and have to leave the room at 10 am (instead of 12 am) in the last day. The noise from the rooms and reception: I’ve heard all door buzzes and rings to the reception… The breakfast was budget: bread, jam, butter and tea or coffee, always the same food. Furniture is very old. The sheets and towels were changed at once during a week No shower gel/shampoo, just a small piece of soap Shower is fixed on the wall pouring all around not me, the shower disperser semi-blocked. TV has 7-8 channels in Italian, I don’t remember channels in English or any other languages. Some rooms are located above reception floor and you should go there by spiral stairs (I’ve seen a poor lady who was dragging her suitcase there…) Bathroom was big enough but dirty: a lot of hairs and smelt bad, toilet bowl was dirty and wasn't cleaned at all during my stay. The owners are quite rude and don’t care about keeping the hotel up and to make guests feel happy, they.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ann187791
Reviews.Content: Once one is used to the fact that this hotel/ pension is on the 5th floor it is great value. Friendly staff, balcony with evening sun to read or have a drink(hotel sells them) , very quiet and handy for terminii station which is a hub of all types of transport. Local shops including supermarket. Rooms and breakfast simple but adequate and free wifi worked well even in my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous!! absolutley vile!”
Reviews.Author: helencrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be the worst on the planet. Staff are the most lazy and rude people i have ever come across. We asked a member of staff for a drink and were told to ask someone else (he was sat down playing with his mobile phone) The breakfast was a dry cob with jam and butter. A lady opposite us asked for some orange juice and was told point blank NO , you have tea! We specifically wanted air con, when asked we were told no as this would mean the whole building would have it on. So it was one HELL of a hot night. A buzzer went off every time someone needed to get in, this went on all night, plus the phone was ringing...we were very close to the reception area, we could hear everything. The shower door did not close properly and the water was hot and cold when showering. This hotel had no view, yellow stains all over the floor. The lift was a cage and we were on the 5th floor, i felt sick we were that high up. The TV did not work, The bathroom smelt damp and was mouldy in the shower. The bed was 2 singles put together. Please stay away from this hotel, we changed hotel first thing the next day..it was that awful. I am just glad this only ruined one day of my holiday. The pictures on the website are very very misleading, you will be seriously dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Va bene”
Reviews.Author: Pamplemuss
Reviews.Content: Not bad in general, looks pretty and cozy, the area is opportune for a traveler (10 mins to walk at Termini, 10 mins to reach Piazza Repubblica with SM degli Angelli, + the neighbour Volturno street has several caffé, shops, internet points etc), beautiful overgrown terrace, rather acceptable colazione. Pretty typical balcony. But beware of night doorman from Sri Lanka!! -- no assistance and loads of 'nothing' talks. And I saw a cockroach once!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: simonshearer
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Domus Mea and I was a bit worried before I went that it had gone downhill given some of the negative comments on TripAdvisor but it hasn't. It is a budget hotel so it does not have 5 star services but it's hard to fault at €35 per night including a very basic breakfast and intermittent free wifi. It's convenient for Rome Termini but on a quiet street so traffic noise is low, yet the area seemed safe to me. The walls are thin so take earplugs but the room and bathroom are more than big enough for one. There is a lift so even though it's on the 5th floor getting in is not a problem.The staff are friendly and willing but not IT experts so the wifi was not always available but I was on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it! Stay away! Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: jba26
Reviews.Content: First off, the only positive about this hotel is the location, however, during our stay we saw several other hotels in the same area so, please, do not count so much on the location. I don't even know where to begin listing the things wrong with this hotel. I guess I'll start by saying that I'm not sure it's even a hotel. It's on the fifth floor of a dirty old building with an antique, rickety elevator. You don't even get to keep your own room key - you have to turn it in to the watchman everytime you leave the hotel. And you have to be buzzed back in when you return. The owners of this hotel are extremely rude - forget about being helpful or friendly. The cleaning woman seemed to hate her job. She was always running around like we were in the way and made us feel guilty for eating the breakfast they provide (because she had to stop cleaning to make it - just left the cleaning materials sit there in the hallway and started getting the food). The breakfast is a hard roll, some plastic-wrapped pieces of bread and jam and coffee. One evening we wanted to enjoy some coffee on the terrace and we had our own instant packets and asked the male owner for some hot water. He responded, "There is no hot water." And we asked, can you turn on the coffee machine or do you have a microwave? He said, "We do not live here!" and said something (rude, I assume) in Italian. And the bathroom! Ugh. The bed was bad enough -- nasty blankets, broken frame -- but the bathroom was not cleaned once during our stay. I venture to say it wasn't cleaned before our stay either because there were "short hairs" int he bidet the first day we arrived. And they remained the whole time. Rust spots in the corners of the shower, dingy feeling, ratty towels - you name it, this "hotel" has it. My husband and I look back and laugh now, but for honeymooners - or really anyone expecting a decent place to stay - this hotel could RUIN your stay in Rome. I consider this "hotel" a scam. There looked to be some better places on Via Cernaia and on the Termini side of Via Masala. Domus Mea Roma is NOT the hotel you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY, SMELLY, RUDE STAFF - STAY AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nzbella
Reviews.Content: We knew not to expect much for our money in Rome, so we didn't bother checking the ratings of Domus Mea too much before booking as it was in our price range. What a terrible mistake... Better start off with the positives - the location is really good. 5 min walk to the train station (to catch tourist buses, airport shuttles, shops + supermarkets), few good resteraunts around, and ONE staff member pleasant and helpful. Free wi-fi. We also didn't catch anything. Those in no way out-weigh the negatives of this truly awful hotel. It is on the fifth floor accessed by the scariest and oldest lift I have ever been in, and even during our short stay it broke down, meaning my elderly parents had to carry large suitcases down flights of stairs. The floor was so dirty when I made the mistake of walking barefoot in the room one day my feet turned BLACK. My partner went for a shower on the afternoon we checked in and found a pair of old, wet, UNDERWEAR in the shower cubicle, obviously left by the previous tennant, which leads you to believe no cleaning staff had been there either. No cleaning was done the entire time we were there (3 nights), no towels changed (including the filthy dish-rag they called a bath mat). The bathrooms of both our room and my parent's room were tiny and smelt extremely bad, there are obviously problems with the plumbing. Air conditioning was an extra 8 euro a day. And the icing on the cake...The notice in our room specified a noon checkout, as did the site we booked through. On the day we left, since we had an afternoon flight and had seen all we could of Rome, we decided to spend our morning packing and sending some emails in the room before leaving shortly before 12pm. At 11.20 we had a knock on the door, and the abrupt woman (think the owner) yelled that we had to leave as she had to clean it (ha!) because people were arriving in 15mins. We were put out but willing to oblige, so as soon as we could made our way out. The elderly man on reception then tsk-ed us and said "very bad people, very bad". I explained that we had thought check-out was 12, at which point he started to yell at us rudely in Italian, interspersed with "bad people". So shocked I was close to tears, we promised him we would write this experience up for others to share. And so we have. Worst hotel I have ever stayed in, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Loud44
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week and on arrival we were asked to pay up front for the entire week before we had even sen the room. Most staff we encountered, except one, spoke very little english. This was a problem when trying to explain that we would like to see the room first, etc and also when asking for help regarding sight-seeing. The breakfast was the same every morning and consisted of a bread roll with jam, a croissant and biscuits. Was ok, but not a patch on other budget hotels breakfasts I've previously had! The sheets and towels were changed every 2 days and the room/bathroom was immaculate. We found the surronding neighbourhood busy at night and it felt safe. Despite it being busy hotel is on a fairly quet side street and we had no problem sleeping. The hotel is a 5 min walk from termini station and I would give it 5 stars for location as it was fab!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: travelsnuv
Reviews.Content: we arrived late at night and the night worker seemed to be in a bad mood and did not greet us at all.. i immediately felt like we entered into a truck stop and could tell the hotel was going to disappoint. it smelled moldy. we were told we had to pay up front for the entire stay and when we told him that seemed strange and it was not according to our booking he got rude and wanted to know what our problem was!??! my husband said he at least wanted to see the room first. so he took us up to our room and although it looked really small and musty, the floor seemed to be clean and we knew we had booked a "cheap" hotel for rome standards and decided to make the full payment. upon returning to the room i pulled down the bedsheets and saw holes in the sheets, but noticed that it appeared at least that they were washed. when we brushed our teeth and got ready for bed, water started running from the drain of the faucet against the wall and the floor in the tiny bathroom started flooding, so water was running over to where the toilet was.. my husband went down to inform and the guy said he couldnt do anything but would leave a note for the day staff. we got some extra towels to bunch up on the floor and clean up the water. in the morning, we told one of the owners about the problem and they werent very responsive, just sort of shrugged us off. we ate breakfast, which was a pre-packaged croissant roll, coffee, strawberry jam, a bun and some crackers with butter. the next days we had the same, except it was clear the buns were a day old. you couldnt sit outside on the patio they show on their website because the door was blocked off with a big chair. upon returning home that night we noticed the sink hadnt been fixed (another conversation between my husband and the staff ensued wherein the night worker said they probably wouldnt fix it the next day because it would be sunday). more towels on the floor. the bed had been made, but that is all that was done in terms of housekeeping, and thats how it went for the rest of our time there. the sink was never even wiped down or the floor swept. the next morning i couldnt get any warm water to come out of the shower so after about 15 minutes of trying both in our shower and in the shower of the small bathroom in the hall (that we found out later was shared by 4 of the other rooms on our floor) i went to speak to the owner, a woman who was very rude and basically accussed me of lying. she showed me that the sink downstairs worked and therefore my shower must have hot water too since its all the same system. then she basically dismissed me and wouldnt come up to our room to check it out. after waiting for some time, i was able to get warm water in the hall bathroom. i think the trick is that only one person in the whole hotel can shower at a time. that night my husband spoke with the night worker again who basically told him we shouldnt expect much, the owners dont care about keeping the hotel up and keeping guests happy because the hotel market in rome is set so they dont have to worry about competition. in summary, basically very rude staff (we also heard other guests fighting with the owners during our stay), dirtiest hotel ive ever stayed in (we felt more like we were camping than in a hotel, check out the pictures) terrible service and bad breakfast. the one redeeming quality of the hotel was that we did sleep well in the hotel as we had a nice breeze coming through and it was very quiet in our room. the bed was reasonably comfortable. and a good nights sleep was much needed after walking arounf rome all day. other than that the hotel was anything but pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: KRP-Oslo Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night in order to catch an early train to the airport. The hotel/room was clean, simple, cheap and conveniently located and I was quite satisfied when leaving yesterday. At this moment, when writing this text I am suffering from large red spots on different parts of my body and I have had a long and itchy night! Since there were no mosquitoes to be seen in the Rome-region and the red spots are a lot larger than when I get bitten by mosquitoes, this strengthens my suspicion that there must have been bed bugs in my room. And that is simply nasty! KRP

Reviews.Title: “ok for one night stay by train station”
Reviews.Author: whomever
Reviews.Content: as others have said, this place is very basic. i stayed here only for 2 nights in order to be near termini train staion- i would not stay there any longer. the rooms are uncomfortable- tiny twin bed, no space to put your luggage other than a wardrobe cabinet, an uncomfortable cane chair, tv was high on a cabinet and hard to view. it did have bbc, which replayed the same hour of paltry news all day long.i asked for a room not facing the street so there was no external noise but you could hear noise in the hallways, at hte reception desk, upstairs, etc. but it was ok for sleeping. the room was dusty and mold on the soap dish- same in the shower- not filthy but it should be much cleaner. breakfast was a croissant, coffee and a large bread roll with one pat of butter and jelly, served at 8 am which can be inconvenieint for an early riser. there's a ceiling fan and sink in the room, share bathroom with only one other room.lighting is poor- no light near the desk in the room. water takes a long time to heat up. at recption, one man was friendly but spoke no english, another was rude and a the night shift guy was asleep when i left. overall i'd stay again for one night if i needed to be near the train station, unless i found something cheaper/better nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: asromaale
Reviews.Content: The least friendly staff I have ever encountered.Room size not for the claustrophobic.Situated not in the greatest area of Roma even if the location is central-I felt uncomfortable walking back to the hotel at night.Didnt think the rooms were cleaned every day like Im used to at other hotels in Rome. Fortunately there are much better hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, very good place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ilsalmi
Reviews.Content: I can only confirm what everyone else is saying. This is no frills, basic and spotlessly clean place. The bathroom was immaculate and modern, heating working and the desk people very very friendly. We loved the coffee in the morning and enjoyed the crusty rolls and croissants for breakfast. Surprisingly the area being this close to Termini was actually nice and felt safe all day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but expect nothing special”
Reviews.Author: KNKSeattle
Reviews.Content: Located fairly close to the train station (5-10 minute walk) so it was the main purpose for our choosing it. It's on the 5th floor of a building that's definitely not appealing. The room was clean, bare bones-definitely no frills and uncomfortable beds. Breakfast is the same every day (hard roll, sweet roll, coffee). If you're wanting romance, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, low cost and in good location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBailey
Reviews.Content: The location was close to the central train station and most bus routes. The helpfulness of the staff was unpredictable. Some were more helpful than others. The rooms were always clean, a roomy bathrrom and breakfast was quick. It is located on the fifth floor and has an elevator. Good low cost hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simpleand clean”
Reviews.Author: WFCFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel location seems a little intimidating in the begining but after a while you realized that's Rome, old, dirty and full of intimidating people. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Simple Breakfast coffee or tea and bread. Rooms and bathroom were cleaned. Room services daily. AC available in the room for 7 Euros per day. The hotel is very closed from Roma Termini, which was great as we used the train to go to Naples and Florence. The tourist bus company for site seing is also located at the terminal. Great price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Katrin_26J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the staff is friendly. The rooms are small, but sufficiently clean. Breakfast is very good for an Italian hotel, although it gets a bit dreary after a couple of days since the choice is small and always the same. The hotel is located centrally (about 10 minutes from Termini station), but you don’t hear any traffic noise. Being in the fifth floor (elevator available), the hotel room provides an awesome view over Rome. However, some construction sites close-by woke me up in the mornings. Air-conditioning is available, but has to be paid extra with 8 EUR per night (5 EUR if you stay longer). It takes a while until you get warm water (but you don’t need that in the heat of the summer anyway). Altogether, we had a pleasant stay in the Domus Mea and for central Rome it provides quite good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but cheap and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: brandycat87
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel after reading some peoples bad reviews. I stayed for five nights and thought it was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, cheap and close to the termini where you can get buses or the metro to any part of the city you wish to see. It's exactly as described on the website venere.com except the breakfast finishes at 10am not 10.30am. The rooms are small but i hardly spent anytime in it apart from to sleep so it wasn't a problem. I would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ausintaiwan
Reviews.Content: Freaked out about staying here because of all the bad reviews but couldn't get past the price and location. Happy to say we had none of the horror stories that we'd read about. Hotel convenient to Termini and neighbourhood not as scary as expected, even nice. Staff very friendly. We got in late but they were all ready and payment method was optional. When the man at the desk (Salvatore I think) found out we spoke Chinese he even wanted to learn how to say some phrases. Rooms are basic but clean. We even had a balcony. Breakfast is a little basic but enough to start the day. Happy to have our own bathroom. Would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel suits basic needs”
Reviews.Author: Maddietravel
Reviews.Content: As a solo female traveller, I stayed two nights -- one week apart -- and I had no hesitation to go back after that first night. Despite the criticisms here of certain facets of this hotel, I LIKED the 5th floor location (it's safe!), found the cage-lift interesting, and the winding staircase up to my room utterly charming. I look forward to different things like this when I travel abroad. I have stayed in the Termini area of Rome before and despite the seediness I feel safer here than any train station-area hotel in the U.S. It is actually about a 10-minute walk from the station, closer to the Repubblica metro station than Termini. I did have to request a change of room to a courtyard-side one as the one on the street-side was very noisy, as is any street-facing room in Rome. Both rooms I saw offered me a nice balcony. There are also innumerable restaurants in the immediate area, frequented by local families. The breakfast is only 2 rolls (very fresh and delicious) and coffee or tea, so if you want a large American-style breakfast you'll have to supplement somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back”
Reviews.Author: brokenbar
Reviews.Content: If your idea of a hotel is Ramada Inn-esque or Hilton, then Domus Mea is NOT for you. We found it delightful! The room was spotlessly clean with a modern bathroom. Yes, you do have take the elevator up to the 5th floor but it works marvelously even if you can only fit 1 person and a couple of suitcases in at a time. The staff was friendly and obliging. This is also the owner's home and they make you feel very welcome. They have a nice small terrace where you can set and observe the street market below. Nothing fancy but very quaint and a friendly feel. The coffee is the best I have ever drank in my life and I am a coffeophile. And yes, the rolls are hard BECAUSE THEY ARE SUPPOSED TO BE. They are hollow puff pastry and were delicious as were the individually packaged sweet bread. They provided us with an excellent map, In addition, the hotel is only a half block away from the main termini so sightseeing is a breeze. Lots of interesting buildings and shops near by and we never felt not safe, not even for a minute. We were taking a cruise so it is some distance to the port but we were able to find fellow ship passengers to split the cost of shuttles from the hotel to the port by posting on our cruise ship's web page for passengers. If plain and decent and a real feel for the area and people is enough for you then Domus Mea is a bargain. We are going back in 2010 and we will be staying several days this time. With the current euro to dollar exchange rate, Domus Mea becomes an even better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Value for price is correct in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hungarian_couple6
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the hotel. We think that the value for price is correct. The room was clean and we had individual bathroom too. The hotel is on a very quiet place and close to the main station (train, bus, metro). We were on a sightseeing tour and just in the night in the hotel. The staff is very friendly and speak more languages. The breakfast was a little bit boring but it is better as you'll get nothing and it is the same like in other 2 star hotels in Europe. The capuccino was fine and the roll was crispy. :-) The elevator was old and little but it can not be authoritative for choosing a hotel because you use it just some time a day. It is a perfect hotel for sightseeing in Rome. We can recommend it to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “For short stays only”
Reviews.Author: Lone Wolf2
Reviews.Content: This place is not very exciting. Very old fashioned and a bit of a dark atmosphere. It is clean however, and breakfast is Ok, but again unexciting. If you are a single male, or a couple used to slumming it a bit (students for example!) then it would be Ok. Definately not for couples, familes or a romantic weekend though. It is only a few minutes walk from the pick up point for Terravision/shuttle buses to Ciampino though.

Reviews.Title: “Strange elevator and boring brekkie!”
Reviews.Author: ABCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel recently. It was a bit of a shock getting into the 'cage like' elevator in the lobby, before finding our room on the 5th floor. The decor was very dark and while it was reasonably clean, it was not worth the rate we were charged. (It was the most expensive one on our 10 days in Italy and the least value.) We had a boring, identical breakfast served every single morning - a hard bread roll, a sweeter (croissant type) bun, one portion of strawberry jam and butter were optional, plus tea or coffee. Zwieback in cellophane packs were available too. Really.....couldn't there be some variety?!! Maybe a glass of juice or a piece of fruit, or a yogurt, for example. The main benefit of the hotel was its walking distance proximity to the Rome Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “economically priced, centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: rotbrot
Reviews.Content: Near Rome mainstation (Termini) the hotel is on a quiet side-road. It provides a decent standard for a very reasonable price. The rooms are clean, the family that runs the hotel is very nice and speaks English and German.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, low budget, mediocre quality”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleJeff
Reviews.Content: I knew when I selected the cheapest private room on Venere.com that I would not be staying in the lap of luxury. The Domus Mea fit my budget but the quality was mediocre at best. First, to access the hotel, you have to be buzzed in an apartment complex and take the lift to the 5th floor. The lobby area was also locked. When I was buzzed in, I noticed it was dark with all sorts of odd photos and decorations. To get to my room, I had to climb an additional flight of steps. The room itself was simply furnished but clean. The bathroom had hairs on the wall and the shower head was covered in lime. Also, the shower head was simply mounted to the wall with a drain in the floor. Water sprayed all over the bathroom. When I left the next morning, the desk clerk was asleep on the sofa in what I assume was the breakfast area. I let myself out and left the key on the desk. It was a bargain for Rome at $80 a night. However, with attention to details (cleanliness, lighting, and maintenance) it could be so much better. I would keep searching next time for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Welshtourist
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Domus Mea in Rome. We were disappointed. The rooms were very basic, the dining tables covered in plastic sheeting, and the "bar" non- existant. Breakfast consists of a rock hard roll and awful jam ,with coffee (forget it). You have to take a rickety (2 person) cage type lift to get into the Hotel, which stars on the 5th floor of a residential block. Had it been cheap we could have understood but it was not.The only advantage was the location being near to the bus and train Station. There is also a nice little pavement cafe/bar around the corner called the Fantasy Pizza. It is a very welcoming little place. The breakfast there is great ,as is the full menu, with prices that are very reasonable and antipasta to die for!

Reviews.Title: “terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: kay_03
Reviews.Content: terrible, terrible, I booked this place and told them I will pay with my credid card, but the hotel denied and scoled me with a loud voice. The room was terribly small, it was like a misery storage. The TV did not work well. The shower did not work and I told the hotel so but they did nothing. Breakfast was hard, taste bad bread and coffee only, which was the worst in Italy.I will not recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Domus Mea Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bolarj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a number of nights recently in the Domus Mea Hotel in Rome. The rooms are basic but functional and clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The service of rooms was excellent. The area is quiet but well situated for transport around Rome. The only disadvantage was the breakfast provided. This consisted of tea/ coffee (neither of which was pleasant to drink), a bread roll and jam/butter and packaged bread. We preferred to have breakfast elsewhere after the first two days.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Domus Mea was OK”
Reviews.Author: DoreenLancs
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in a good location it was not premier quality but you must balance this against cost. It was value for money with basic facilities if you only use it as a base for exploration of Rome.It was not to far to walk from the train staion. The lift is an antique.Overall we loved Rome but you obviously get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy with Domus Mea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. The room was adequate, but obviously had not been cleaned under the bed for some time. I figured I could live with that, what really bothered me about this place was the bathroom down the hall. It was filthy. On the day we got there there were odd stains in the shower and large balls of hair- four days later they were still there with no sign of a cleaning in sight. The shower leaked, which wasn't the end of the world, but the bath towel left in the bathroom to mop up the overflow was nearly black- it had obviously been used for that purpose for a long time and was never changed while we were there. The toilet had some problems flushing, as we discovered the first night of our stay- we were treated to the view of someone's used condom which remained floating in the toilet until the next day, despite repeated flushing. We spent as little time as possible at this hotel, and really wished we had somewhere else to stay. Other than the bathroom it was mostly fine- breakfast was quite good-- but for us the state of the bathroom was a dealbreaker.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes simple is oh so perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Domus Mea the summer before last. I have been sending friends there ever since! Where to begin.... Salvatore....Salvatore...Salvatore. He's the Son of the owners and runs the hotel. Well, did when I was there. Nicest guy, let me tell you. Speaks perfect English too. As soon as I checked in, Salvatore offered me a cappuccino. Nice..... And, by far, the best damn cappuccino I had in Rome! I mean it's the personal touches, the little things, that make the day a wee bit brighter, Si? I had two rooms there. The first was just down the hall from the front desk. I liked this room: simple and comfortable. Air conditioned too. I left the hotel and came back from traveling, and was given room number 19 - a great single on the upper floor. It didn't have the bidet and better shower my other room had, but it had a tiny balcony and it was nice to be a bit removed from the entrance. Ok. My only gripe is the PILLOWS! Mama Mia.... note to self: send Salvatore some comfortable pillows! Like sleeping on a bag of socks. Interesting to say the least. The breakfast was simple, but this is the way Italians eat for those nagging to complain for no reason. The bread was good, the coffee was as well, and it was nice to sit outside on the terrace and watch the windows opening of the people who lived across the way, as if taking a peek at a drive in movie without paying... A slice of daily life in Rome.... Bella. Everyone was incredibly nice to me. I was traveling alone and I felt entirely comfortable staying there and in the area in general. The proximity to Termini station can't be beat! And, there's a great little restaurant just around the corner that gets packed in the evenings and is exceptionally good and CHEAP. It's called "Ristorante La Famiglia". Ask anyone in the area, they all go there. Try the Carbonara and you'll know why fattening things are just meant to be SAVORED.... I'll be staying there again this fall. If it ain't broke, don't fix it. And, the Domus Mea is pure Kitsch with a whole lot of heart. It's good as gold as is. See you soon Salvatore!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel this March 2005. It is in an old building and located on the 5th floor. The elevator is very small and the ride is scary. The room is okay but the bathroom with its shower over the toilet is really bad and it is always wet after a shower and the water leaks out to the room. The brakfast (free) is quite boring with one boule, two crackers, butter and jam and the only good part is we get good coffee and hot milk. The building itself is on a busy street which is always noisy. The only advantage for this hotel is it is located near the main train station and the bus stops. If I visit Rome again I will not stay in this hotel but will look for something better nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Domus Mea
HotelInfo.Address: Via Calatafimi, 31, 00185 Rome, Italy
